constructor.desc:
This constructor creates a request object that can be used to make network
requests. The constructor takes a single parameter `options` which is used to
set several properties on the resulting `Request`.

params.desc:
Contains the following properties:

**url** (*string*)

This is the url to which the request will be made.

**[onComplete]** (*function*)

This function will be called when the request has received a response (or in
terms of XHR, when `readyState == 4`). The function is passed a `Response`
object.

**[headers]** (*object*)

An unordered collection of name/value pairs representing headers to send
with the request.

**[content]** (*string*,*object*)

The content to send to the server. If `content` is a string, it
should be URL-encoded (use `encodeURIComponent`). If `content` is
an object, it should be a collection of name/value pairs. Nested
objects & arrays should encode safely.

For `GET` requests, the query string (`content`) will be appended
to the URL. For `POST` requests, the query string will be sent as
the body of the request.

**[contentType]** (*string*)

The type of content to send to the server. This explicitly sets the
`Content-Type` header. The default value is `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`.
params.name: options

functions.desc: Make a `GET` request.
functions.name: get

functions.desc: Make a `POST` request.
functions.name: post

classes.name: Request

properties.desc: URL to send request to
properties.name: url

properties.desc: {string,object} content to send with the request
properties.name: content

properties.desc: Content-Type to send along with the request.
properties.name: contentType

properties.desc: the `Response`, populated upon completion.
properties.name: response

classes.desc:
The Response object contains the response to a network request issued using a
`Request` object. It is returned by the `get()` or `post()` method of a
`Request` object.

All members of a `Response` object are read-only.
classes.name: Response

properties.desc: The content of the response as plain text.
properties.name: text

properties.desc: The HTTP response status code (e.g. *200*).
properties.name: status

properties.desc: The HTTP response status line (e.g. *OK*).
properties.name: statusText

properties.desc:
The content of the response as a JavaScript object. The value will be `null`
if the document cannot be processed by `JSON.parse`.
properties.name: json

properties.desc: The HTTP response headers represented as key/value pairs.
properties.name: headers

functions.desc:
set a listener to be notified on interesting, events like when you're
over quota.

The name of the event to listen for, the only supported event is
`OverQuota`.
params.name: event

params.desc: a function to be invoked when the event fires.
params.name: listener

functions.desc: remove a listener previously set via the `on` method.
functions.name: removeListener

params.desc:
The name of the event to remove a listener for, the only supported event is
`OverQuota`.
params.name: event

params.desc: a reference to the function that was previously set as a listener with `on`
params.name: listener

properties.desc:
A special property which may be read or write and is backed
by a (JSON formatted) disk file for persistence.
properties.name: storage

properties.desc: (read-only) Returns the amount of the quota used by this store
properties.name: quotaUsage

functions.desc:
Returns a function C that creates instances of privateCtor.  C may be called
with or without the new keyword.  The prototype of each instance returned
from C is C.prototype, and C.prototype is an object whose prototype is
privateCtor.prototype.  Instances returned from C will therefore be instances
of both C and privateCtor.  Additionally, the constructor of each instance
returned from C is C.
functions.name: publicConstructor

params.desc: A constructor.
params.name: privateCtor

returns.desc: A function that makes new instances of privateCtor.

functions.desc:
Returns a validated options dictionary given some requirements.  If any of
the requirements are not met, an exception is thrown.
functions.name: validateOptions

params.desc:
An object, the options dictionary to validate.  It's not modified.
        If it's null or otherwise falsey, an empty object is assumed.
params.name: options

params.desc:
An object whose keys are the expected keys in options.  Any key in
        options that is not present in requirements is ignored.  Each value
        in requirements is itself an object describing the requirements of
        its key.  There are four optional keys in this object:
          map: A function that's passed the value of the key in options.
               map's return value is taken as the key's value in the final
               validated options, is, and ok.  If map throws an exception
               it's caught and discarded, and the key's value is its value in
               options.
          is:  An array containing any number of the typeof type names.  If
               the key's value is none of these types, it fails validation.
               Arrays and null are identified by the special type names
               "array" and "null"; "object" will not match either.  No type
               coercion is done.
          ok:  A function that's passed the key's value.  If it returns
               false, the value fails validation.
          msg: If the key's value fails validation, an exception is thrown.
               This string will be used as its message.  If undefined, a
               generic message is used, unless is is defined, in which case
               the message will state that the value needs to be one of the
               given types.
params.name: requirements

returns.desc:
An object whose keys are those keys in requirements that are also in
        options and whose values are the corresponding return values of map
        or the corresponding values in options.  Note that any keys not
        shared by both requirements and options are not in the returned
        object.

functions.desc:
Adds a collection property to the given object.  Setting the property to a
scalar value empties the collection and adds the value.  Setting it to an
array empties the collection and adds all the items in the array.
functions.name: addCollectionProperty

params.desc: The property will be defined on this object.
params.name: obj

params.desc: The name of the property.
params.name: propName

params.desc: If given, this will be used as the collection's backing array.
params.name: array

functions.desc: A collection is ordered, like an array, but its items are unique, like a set.
functions.name: Collection

params.desc:
The collection is backed by an array.  If this is given, it will be
       used as the backing array.  This way the caller can fully control the
       collection.  Otherwise a new empty array will be used, and no one but
       the collection will have access to it.
params.name: array

functions.desc:
Provides iteration over the collection.  Items are yielded in the order
they were added.
functions.name: __iterator__

functions.desc:
Adds a single item or an array of items to the collection.  Any items
already contained in the collection are ignored.

params.desc: An item or array of items.

returns.desc: The collection.

functions.desc:
Removes a single item or an array of items from the collection.  Any items
not contained in the collection are ignored.
functions.name: remove

params.desc: An item or array of items.
params.name: itemOrItems

returns.desc: The collection.

properties.desc: The number of items in the collection.
properties.name: length

file.desc: Allows for the reading and writing of files.

functions.desc: Opens a file in text mode and returns a string containing its entire contents.
functions.name: read

params.desc: The path of the file to read.
params.name: path

returns.desc: A string containing the file's entire contents.

functions.desc:
Creates a text file and writes the entir contents of a string to
it.
functions.name: write

params.desc: The path at which the file should be created
params.name: path

params.desc: The content to write.
params.name: content

throws.desc: if file exists, or cannot be created.

functions.desc: Returns a stream providing access to the contents of a file.
functions.name: open

params.desc: The path of the file to open.
params.name: path

params.desc:
An optional string, each character of which describes a characteristic of the
returned stream.  If the string contains `"r"`, the file is opened in
read-only mode.  `"w"` opens the file in write-only mode.  `"b"` opens the
file in binary mode.  If `"b"` is not present, the file is opened in text
mode, and its contents are assumed to be UTF-8.  If *`mode`* is not given,
`"r"` is assumed, and the file is opened in read-only text mode.
params.name: [mode]

returns.desc:
A stream that can be used to access or modify the contents of the file.  See
[`text-streams`](#module/api-utils/text-streams) and
[`byte-streams`](#module/api-utils/byte-streams) for more information.
Opened files should always be closed after use by calling `close` on the
returned stream.

functions.desc:
Takes a function and returns a wrapped one instead, calling which will call
original function in the next turn of event loop. This is basically utility
to do `setTimeout(function() { ... }, 0)`, with a difference that returned
function is reused, instead of creating a new one each time. This also allows
to use this functions as event listeners.
functions.name: Enqueued

functions.desc:
Invokes `callee` by passing `params` as an arguments and `self` as `this`
pseudo-variable. Returns value that is returned by a callee.
functions.name: invoke

params.desc: Function to invoke.
params.name: callee

params.desc: Arguments to invoke function with.
params.name: params

params.desc: Object to be passed as a `this` pseudo variable.
params.name: self

params.desc:
The stream is backed by this nsIInputStream.  It must already be
  opened.
params.name: inputStream

params.desc:
Text in inputStream is expected to be in this character encoding.  If
  not given, "UTF-8" is assumed.  See nsICharsetConverterManager.idl for
  documentation on how to determine other valid values for this.
params.name: charset

classes.desc:
An input stream that reads text from a backing stream using a given text
encoding.

functions.desc:
Reads a string from the stream.  If the stream is closed, an exception is
thrown.
functions.name: read

params.desc:
The number of characters to read.  If not given, the remainder of
        the stream is read.
params.name: numChars

returns.desc:
The string read.  If the stream is already at EOS, returns the
        empty string.

classes.name: TextReader

functions.desc:
A buffered output stream that writes text to a backing stream using a given
text encoding.
functions.name: TextWriter

params.desc:
The stream is backed by this nsIOutputStream.  It must already be
       opened.
params.name: outputStream

params.desc:
Text will be written to outputStream using this character encoding.
       If not given, "UTF-8" is assumed.  See nsICharsetConverterManager.idl
       for documentation on how to determine other valid values for this.
params.name: charset

functions.desc: Flushes the backing stream's buffer.
functions.name: flush

functions.desc:
Writes a string to the stream.  If the stream is closed, an exception is
thrown.
functions.name: write

params.desc: The string to write.
params.name: str

functions.desc:
Writes a string on a background thread.  After the write completes, the
backing stream's buffer is flushed, and both the stream and the backing
stream are closed, also on the background thread.  If the stream is already
closed, an exception is thrown immediately.
functions.name: writeAsync

params.desc: The string to write.
params.name: str

params.desc:
An optional function.  If given, it's called as callback(error) when
       the write completes.  error is an Error object or undefined if there
       was no error.  Inside callback, |this| is the stream object.
params.name: callback

functions.desc:
Closes both the stream and its backing stream.  If the stream is already
closed, an exception is thrown.  For TextWriters, this first flushes the
backing stream's buffer.
functions.name: close

properties.desc: True iff the stream is closed.
properties.name: closed

Use this to check whether the given version (e.g. xulApp.platformVersion)
is in the given range. Versions must be in version comparator-compatible
format. See MDC for details:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en/XPCOM_Interface_Reference/nsIVersionComparator

chromeless.desc: Chromeless Browser Dev Kit based on Jetpack SDK. Application development made easy.
chromeless.name: chromeless

app-paths.desc:
Returns various paths that are pertinent to the currently running
application and logged in user.

properties.desc:
The currently active *profile*, which is a user specific directory where
user scoped application data may reside, such as preferences and history.
properties.name: profileDir

properties.desc:
The path where the *browser code* of the application resides on disk.
For an installed application this usually be nested inside of a system wide installation path.
This path should be expected to be read-only.
properties.name: browserCodeDir

properties.desc:
On windows, the path to the start menu where shortcuts may be installed.
`null` on other platforms.
properties.name: startMenuDir

properties.desc: The path to the user's desktop.
properties.name: desktopDir

properties.desc: The path to the currently logged in user's home directory.
properties.name: userHomeDir

properties.desc:
In chromeless, *profiles* are specially named directories stored
in a user scoped location.  Support for multiple profiles is built in at a very
low level, and the basic mechanism by which profiles are supported is a two
level directory structure.  This property provides the path to the "outer" or
"root" profile directory, under which different profiles reside.
properties.name: profileRootDir

properties.desc:
The path to the directory where web plugins will be loaded for this
application.
properties.name: pluginsDir

properties.desc: The current working directory of the chromeless application process.
properties.name: curDir

properties.desc: The system's temporary directory.
properties.name: tmpDir

appinfo.desc:
[`appinfo.json`](#guide/startup-parameters) is a small file that contains
various application parameters used in startup and packaging.

This module give you conveinent read access to this file

properties.name: contents

throws.desc:
upon access if the appinfo.json file is malformed (this should happen
at application startup, and never during runtime.  In application code this
exception can be safely ignored).

Stops the server from accepting new connections. This function is
asynchronous, the server is finally closed when the server emits a
'close' event.

Tools for enhancing drag and drop session. It makes possible to associate 
a file with an existing drag session, and to write a file to the disk
when the drop happens in the OS folder.

params.name: mode

params.desc: for success.

params.desc: for error.
params.name: callback

favicon.desc:
Tools for accessing favicons, which use a local cache to minimize
network requests

favicon.

functions.desc:
Fetch the favicon for a particular page.  This function will return
the favicon from the cache if available, but otherwise will issue a
network request to attempt to fetch a site's favicon.
functions.name: fetch

params.desc: The page for which a favicon will be fetched.
params.name: uri

params.desc:
A callback that will be invoked once the fetch is
  complete.  Will be passed a single string argument which is a data url
  containing the favicon requested.  If the icon couldn't be fetched or
  is not available, a default will be returned.
params.name: cb

The fs module provides means to interact with the file system for manipulating
and querying files and directories.

functions.desc:
Given a path returns metadata about the file or directory.  If the path is a symlink it
will be dereferenced and information about the underlying file will be returned
functions.name: stat

params.desc: The path to a file.
params.name: path

returns.desc:
Returns an object with information about the file, including:

 + `type` - either 'file' or 'directory'
 + `numEntries` - (for directories), the number of files in the directory.
 + `size` - (for files), the size of the file in bytes.
 + `lastModified` - (for files), the time (in seconds since epoch) of the last file modification.

functions.name: disable

functions.desc: Toggle fullscreen.

hotkey.desc: Add shortcut key combinations or "hotkeys" to your application.

functions.desc:
Register a global hotkey that executes JS specified [command] when the key
combination in [hotkey] is pressed.
functions.name: register

params.desc:
Key combination in the format of 'modifier-key'
Examples:

    accel-s, meta-shift-i, control-alt-d

Modifier keynames:

 + **shift**: The Shift key.
 + **alt**: The Alt key. On the Macintosh, this is the Option key. On Macintosh 
         this can only be used in conjunction with another modifier, since 
         Alt+Letter combinations are reserved for entering special characters 
         in text.
 + **meta**: The Meta key. On the Macintosh, this is the Command key.
 + **control**: The Control key.
 + **accel**: The key used for keyboard shortcuts on the user's platform, which 
           is Control on Windows and Linux, and Command on Mac. Usually, this 
           would be the value you would use.
 + **access**: The access key for activating menus and other elements. On Windows, 
            this is the Alt key, used in conjuction with an element's accesskey.
 + **any**: Indicates that all modifiers preceding it are optional.
params.name: hotkey

params.desc:
{string/function} command Javascript (may be of type String or Function) 
                                 to execute when the hotkey is executed.

Optional. Unique identifier for this hotkey, which will 
                     auto-generated if not provided.
params.name: [id]

returns.desc: Return the ID of the hotkey.

throws.desc: Textual exception that should be caught by the programmer.

functions.desc: Register a global hotkey.
functions.name: unregister

params.desc: {string/function} command

throws.desc: Textual exception that should be caught by the programmer.

Draw a menu element to the canvas (a XUL document)
Usually this function is invoked by setParent()

Redraws a menu element to the canvas (a XUL document) if needed.
Usually called called by a function that performs a mutation on a SubMenu

functions.desc:
Register a globally accessible hotkey for this menu item that invokes 
the 'onClick' handler if set when the key combination is pressed.
functions.name: setHotKey

functions.desc:
Removes a menu item from the canvas (a XUL document) and does basic 
garbage collection.
functions.name: destroy

classes.name: Menu

params.desc:
a set of options/ properties that will be set on the 
                       menu item. Keys are case-insensitive.
params.name: nodes

params.desc: parent Menu instance that will show the SubMenu when hovered
params.name: parent

functions.desc:
Draw a submenu element to the canvas (a XUL document)
Usually this function is invoked by setParent()
functions.name: draw

functions.desc:
Removes a submenu from the canvas (a XUL document), including its children
and does basic garbage collection.
functions.name: destroy

functions.desc:
Adds one or more elements to the end of an array and returns the new 
length of the array.
functions.name: push

functions.desc: Convert this SubMenu instance to an Array-representation.
functions.name: toArray

functions.desc:
(re-)Construct this SubMenu instance with Menu or Separator instances
from array.
functions.name: fromArray

params.desc: an array of Menu or Separator instances.
params.name: arr

classes.name: SubMenu

params.desc:
{Menu/SubMenu} parent parent Menu or SubMenu instance that will contain 
                             the separator

functions.desc:
Draw a separator element to the canvas (a XUL document)
Usually this function is invoked by setParent()
functions.name: draw

functions.desc:
Removes a separator item from the canvas (a XUL document) and does basic 
garbage collection.
functions.name: destroy

classes.name: Separator

mime.desc: Tools for guessing mime types from file extensions/paths.

functions.desc: Given a file path (or extension), look up an appropriate mime type.
functions.name: guess

params.desc: (`/foo/bar/baz.txt/) or just a file extension (`exe`)
params.name: path

returns.desc: appropriate mime type for input

properties.desc:
The default mime type that will be used when we encounter an unknown extension
type.
properties.name: defaultMime

functions.desc:
A module that exposes abstract operations on file paths.  Functions
in this module operate on path strings, but do not ever interact with
the file system.  For reading/writing files, see [file].  For other
filesystem operations, see [fs].
functions.name: validPathPart

functions.desc:
joins any number of path components with the platform appropriate
path separator.
functions.name: join

params.desc: variable number of parameters to be joined
params.name: A

returns.desc: The joined path

functions.desc: normalizes a path and splits it into an array of path components
functions.name: split

params.desc: A path to split
params.name: path

returns.desc: Path components.

functions.desc:
normalizes an array of path components, properly reducing entries such as
'..' and blank paths.
functions.name: normalizeArray

params.desc: Path components.
params.name: components

returns.desc: Normalized path components.

functions.desc: normalizes a path.
functions.name: normalize

params.desc: The path to normalize.
params.name: path

returns.desc: A normalized path.

functions.desc:
Given a path, extract the *directory name* component.  For instance,
`dirname("/foo/bar/baz.txt") --> "/foo/bar"`.

*Note: this function operates on strings alone, and will not interact with
the file system.*
functions.name: dirname

params.desc: A filesystem path.
params.name: path

returns.desc: The directory part of the path.

functions.desc:
Given a path, extract the filename component.  For instance,
`basename("/foo/bar/baz.txt") --> "baz.txt"`.  If an extension
argument is provided, and matches the extension present in the
path, it will be removed: `basename("/foo/bar/baz.txt", ".txt") --> "baz"`

*Note: this function operates on strings alone, and will not interact with
the file system.*
functions.name: basename

params.desc: A filesystem path.
params.name: path

params.desc:
An extension string, if present and matches the
                 path, will be removed from the resulting filename.
params.name: [ext]

returns.desc: The filename component of the path.

functions.desc:
Return the extension of a path:
`extname("/foo/bar/baz.txt") --> ".txt"`.  If an extension
argument is provided, and matches the extension present in the
path, it will be removed: `dirname("/foo/bar/baz.txt", ".txt") --> "baz"`

*Note: this function operates on strings alone, and will not interact with
the file system.*
functions.name: extname

params.desc: A filesystem path.
params.name: path

returns.desc: The filename component of the path.

development-mode.desc: Adds Jetpack SDK development functionality to a program.
development-mode.name: development-mode

test-harness.desc: A harness for running Jetpack tests.
test-harness.name: test-harness
